1.name: It's a Wonderful Life
1.description: An angel is sent from Heaven to help a desperately frustrated businessman by showing him what life would have been like if he had never existed.

2.name: A Stolen Life
2.description: When a woman's twin sister is drowned, she assumes her identity in order to be close to the man she feels her sister took from her years before.

3.name: The Falcon's Alibi
3.description: A wealthy woman's secretary, fearing that she will be blamed if her employer's jewelry is stolen, hires the Falcon as guardian. The Falcon is blamed when the jewels are stolen and murders ...                See full summary »

4.name: The Postman Always Rings Twice
4.description: A married woman and a drifter fall in love, then plot to murder her husband.

5.name: Claudia and David
5.description: Follow-up to hit film Claudia (1943) finds title characters (Dorothy McGuire, Robert Young) dealing with the ups and downs of marriage and parenthood in their rural Connecticut town. ...                See full summary »

6.name: Notorious
6.description: A woman is asked to spy on a group of Nazi friends in South America. How far will she have to go to ingratiate herself with them?

7.name: Dick Tracy vs. Cueball
7.description: Expensive diamonds are stolen but before the thief can fence them he is strangled by ex-con Cueball, who then takes the gems and continues murdering people he believes are trying to swindle...                See full summary »

8.name: The Big Sleep
8.description: Private detective Philip Marlowe is hired by a rich family. Before the complex case is over, he's seen murder, blackmail, and what might be love.

9.name: Song of the South
9.description: The kindly story-teller Uncle Remus tells a young boy stories about trickster Br'er Rabbit, who outwits Br'er Fox and slow-witted Br'er Bear.

10.name: The Best Years of Our Lives
10.description: Three World War II veterans return home to small-town America to discover that they and their families have been irreparably changed.

11.name: The Stranger
11.description: An investigator from the War Crimes Commission travels to Connecticut to find an infamous Nazi.

12.name: Till the Clouds Roll By
12.description: Biography of songwriter, Broadway pioneer, Jerome Kern. Unable to find immediate success in the USA, Kern sought recognition abroad. He journeyed to England where his dreams of success became real and where he met his future wife Eva.

13.name: Dressed to Kill
13.description: Sherlock Holmes sets out to discover why a trio of murderous villains, including a dangerously attractive female, are desperate to obtain three unassuming and inexpensive little music boxes.

14.name: Gilda
14.description: A small-time gambler hired to work in a Buenos Aires casino learns that his ex-lover is married to his employer.

15.name: La belle et la bête
15.description: A beautiful young woman takes her father's place as the prisoner of a mysterious beast, who wishes to marry her.

16.name: The Harvey Girls
16.description: On a train trip West to become a mail-order bride, Susan Bradley meets a cheery crew of young women travelling out to open a " Harvey House " restaurant at a remote whistle-stop.

17.name: My Darling Clementine
17.description: The Earps battle the Clantons at the OK Corral in Tombstone, Arizona.

18.name: A Matter of Life and Death
18.description: A British wartime aviator who cheats death must argue for his life before a celestial court.

19.name: The Killers
19.description: Hit men kill an unresisting victim, and investigator Reardon uncovers his past involvement with beautiful, deadly Kitty Collins.

20.name: The Razor's Edge
20.description: An adventuresome young man goes off to find himself and loses his socialite fiancée in the process. But when he returns 10 years later, she will stop at nothing to get him back, even though she is already married.

21.name: Great Expectations
21.description: A humble orphan suddenly becomes a gentleman with the help of an unknown benefactor.

22.name: The Blue Dahlia
22.description: An ex-bomber pilot is suspected of murdering his unfaithful wife.

23.name: The Spiral Staircase
23.description: In 1916, a shadowy serial killer is targeting women with "afflictions"; one night during a thunderstorm, the mute Helen feels menaced.

24.name: The Strange Love of Martha Ivers
24.description: A man is reunited with his childhood friend and her husband, who believe he knows the truth about the death of her rich aunt years earlier.

25.name: Lost City of the Jungle
25.description: A new radioactive element is found that is a defense against the atomic bomb. Warmongers go to Pendrang as archaeologists, but they are searching in secret for the element. The United Peace...                See full summary »

26.name: The Yearling
26.description: A boy persuades his parents to allow him to adopt a young deer, but what will happen if the deer misbehaves?

27.name: The Dark Mirror
27.description: A man is found murdered, with witnesses convinced about the woman they saw leaving his apartment. However, it becomes apparent that the woman has a twin, and finding out which one is the killer seems impossible.

28.name: To Each His Own
28.description: An unwed mother, forced to give up her child to avoid scandal, follows her son's life from afar even as she prospers in business.

29.name: Dragonwyck
29.description: A simple Connecticut farm girl is recruited by a distant relative, an aristocratic patroon, to be governess to his young daughter in his Hudson Valley mansion.

30.name: The Dark Corner
30.description: Secretary tries to help her boss, who is framed for a murder.

31.name: Never Say Goodbye
31.description: Both living in New York City, successful artist Phillip Gayley, most renowned for his series of Gayley Girls (swimsuit models in evocative poses), and Ellen Gayley, a one time Gayley Girl, ...                See full summary »

32.name: Of Human Bondage
32.description: A medical student with a club foot falls for a beautiful but ambitious waitress. She soon leaves him, but gets pregnant and comes back to him for help.

33.name: Piccadilly Incident
33.description: Anna Neagle is a World War II W.R.E.N., the counterpart of the American W.A.V.E., who encounters Michael Wilding in a blacked-out Piccadilly during an air raid. They get married and have a ...                See full summary »

34.name: Duel in the Sun
34.description: Beautiful half-breed Pearl Chavez becomes the ward of her dead father's first love and finds herself torn between her sons, one good and the other bad.

35.name: Cluny Brown
35.description: A free-spirited parlor maid and a Czech refugee surprise an English village with their unconventional ways.

36.name: Terror by Night
36.description: When the fabled Star of Rhodesia diamond is stolen on a London to Edinburgh train and the son of its owner is murdered, Sherlock Holmes must discover which of his suspicious fellow passengers is responsible.

37.name: Paisà
37.description: The language barrier has tragic consequences in a series of unrelated stories set during the Italian Campaign of WWII.

38.name: Lady in the Lake
38.description: The lady editor of a crime magazine hires Philip Marlowe to find the wife of her boss. The private detective soon finds himself involved in murder.

39.name: The Strange Woman
39.description: In 1820s New England beautiful but poor and manipulative Jenny Hager marries rich old man Isaiah Poster but also seduces his son and his company foreman.

40.name: Canyon Passage
40.description: Businessman Logan Stuart is torn between his love of two very different women in 1850's Oregon and his loyalty to a compulsive gambler friend who goes over the line.

41.name: The Time of Their Lives
41.description: Two ghosts who were mistakenly branded as traitors during the Revolutionary War return to 20th century New England to retrieve a letter from George Washington which would prove their ...                See full summary »

42.name: Cloak and Dagger
42.description: In WW2, the Allies race against time to persuade two nuclear scientists working for the Germans to switch sides.

43.name: Undercurrent
43.description: Middle-aged bride Ann Hamilton soon begins to suspect that her charming husband is really a psychotic who plans to murder her.

44.name: Make Mine Music
44.description: Animation done to contemporary popular music.

45.name: Green for Danger
45.description: After the nurse who declares that a recent surgical death was a murder dies also, an enigmatic Scotland Yard inspector arrives to investigate.

46.name: Deception
46.description: A piano teacher believes that her fiancé was killed on the battlefield. When he miraculously returns, they decide to marry, but are threatened by a wealthy, egotistical composer the piano teacher started dating on the rebound after she became convinced her love had died.

47.name: The Crimson Ghost
47.description: A criminal mastermind known as the Crimson Ghost is out to steal a device called the Cyclotrode, which can short-circuit all electrical currents on the planet.

48.name: A Night in Casablanca
48.description: The Marx Brothers are employed at a hotel in postwar Casablanca, where a ring of Nazis is trying to recover a cache of stolen treasure.

49.name: The Trap
49.description: When a troupe of showgirls with their impresario and press agent vacation at a Malibu Beach resort, two of them are garroted. Charlie takes on the case assisted by Number Two Son Jimmy and faithful chauffeur Birmingham Brown.

50.name: Night and Day
50.description: A fictionalized biopic of composer Cole Porter from his days at Yale in the 1910s through the height of his success to the 1940s.
